headline: Oatmeal Craisin Cookies
description: This craisin cookie recipe uses dried cranberries, oatmeal, and raisins for a delicious, chewy treat perfect for lunch boxes and afternoon snacks.
name: Oatmeal Craisin Cookies
recipeIngredient: 1 cup sweetened dried cranberries (such as Craisins®)

recipeInstructions.text: Preheat the oven to 350 degrees F (175 degrees C). Grease cookie sheets.

Beat together butter, sugars, eggs, and vanilla in a large bowl with an electric mixer until light and fluffy, about 5 minutes. Combine oats, flour, baking soda, baking powder, and salt in a separate bowl. Add flour mixture, 1 cup at a time, beating batter briefly after each addition. Mix in raisins and cranberries. Drop by spoonfuls onto the prepared cookie sheets.
Bake in the preheated oven until edges are golden, 12 to 14 minutes.

review.reviewBody: This is THE most popular cookie I have ever made. People are clamoring for it. I add 1 t ginger and 1 t cinnamon. I cut down the sugars to 3/4 cups of each. Then when making for my grandboys, I omit the craisins and raisins and add chocolate chips. They devour these. Better than regular chocolate chips because of the oatmeal. Lastly, for the adults, I add kosher or sea salt to the top of each cookie. I think THIS is why they are so unique.

I don't usually do these ratings but I couldn't resist this one. I've made these countless times and they have never disappointed. Following the recipe is a must. I used the same procedure as Britt Rounseville.
turned out great! no changes, followed recipe and everyone loved them
The BEST oatmeal cookie I've ever had! Only thing I did differently was to add chopped walnuts. MAKE THEM. :)
Great recipe! Soft and chewy how I prefer. I added 1/2c less white sugar and added walnuts.

I followed recipe exactly. Baked for 12 mins and they are a nice chewy cookie. Mine did not fall apart at all. I refrigerated my dough while oven was preheating and in between batches. I used a scoop so cookies were uniform and I slightly flattened with a fork before baking. I left them on the cookie sheet after baking for 2 mins and then transferred to rack. I’m making for a gathering and made extra for family. Family liked them. I don’t buy quick oats but was given a good amount so I will definitely make these again.
fell apart
Wonderful !! I wouldn't change a thing!

Made this exactly as written and we're very happy with them. The baking powder does make the cookie spread more than recipes that don't include it, but I watched my baking time and they are chewy and delicious. I left them on the racks to firm up longer than I do with plumper cookies, don't want them to all stick together in the cookie jar!
Baked up nicely and still some moist. Everyone loved them

I was looking for an oatmeal recipe that my husband would love. This is it! He hates raisins so I used an extra half cup of cranberry and I also added 1 cup of pecans. Other than that, I followed the recipe. Perfect!
It was great! Followed it according to recipe. Used a scoop to make them rounded. Pressed each cookie with a fork to even out the cookie. Husband loved them!!!
delicious! swap cranberries with more raisins and walnuts! Yum!!!

Just love this recipe and want to try more like these. But anyone who want to make this amazing Oatmeal recipe with different toppings, then must checkout this........am sure you'd love these toppings also.

https://thehubcook.com/oatmeal-recipes/
These were one of the best cookies I have ever made, and I have been baking for over 50 years. Made no changes, it didn’t need any. Gave out the recipe to friends and family as they requested it!

I ended up adding an extra 1/2 cup of oats and an extra 1/2 cup of flour. I only used crasins.
I used unsalted butter and self-rising flour. The original recipe was too soft with all the butter. The cookies were too flat. I adding the extra oats and flour made them perfect. I want to make them again and add pecans to them.
They were good. I would make again. They were definitely crunchy. I think the next time I would make sure the craisens were soft.
Delicious cookies. I omitted the raisins, but kept the craisins and added 1 cup of white chocolate chips instead. Baked at 375 convection for 10 minutes.
Everyone absolutely loves them???

We love flavor and these cookies are loaded with flavor.
They cooked perfectly and tasted wonderful!
(I don't keep shortening in the pantry so I had to use butter)
5 Star recipe for sure!
Thank you!
The only change I made was using all cruising and no raisins. I found it too crumbly and too salty. Next time I'll reduce the salt to 3/4 tsp and add another egg.
Perfect oatmeal cookies
I made these with Golden Raisins and white chocolate chips. Excellent!

Made with all Raisins and no Craisins.
Hubby loved them. Crispy edges and chewy center .
Best Oatmeal Cookie recipe I’ve tried. Can’t go wrong.
I used old fashioned oats, cranberries and walnuts. Cookies are hard to leave alone. I will make these again!

My family and I loved the way these cookies turned out. Soft and chewy recipe. After we made the cookies the original way and tasted how delicious they were we decided to add milk chocolate morsels and just craisins. Hands down a very delicious recipe!
Too sweet! I agree with another person regarding the sweetness overload. I probably could’ve got away with just the brown sugar and didn’t need the extra cup of white sugar.

These came out like Tate’s oatmeal raisin cookies! I followed the basic recipe but did add teaspoon of cinnamon and 1/2 cup of maple syrup. I also used all brown sugar. They do spread but I liked that the were crispy on the edges with chewy middles. Recipe makes a lot of batter, so I made about 12 cookies and spread the rest in a brownie pan for bars... soooo good! Standard size brownie pan about 40min at 350. I think next time I will cut 1/2cup of sugar (they were really sweet) and add the extra cup of oats as other have suggested.
I used 2 cups of craisins instead of raisins, 1 cup of shredded coconut, 1cup of walnuts, 1 cup of semi sweet/bittersweet chocolate chips, 1 tsp cinnamon, and 1/2 tsp nutmeg.
Excellent! They won't last long.
I made these cookies and they came out good. The only thing I change was the bake time I baked them for 15 minutes.
I made them as read, except I used a little applesauce in place of some butter. These are ones I got a pic of before they were eaten!
Theyre good, easy to make in my kitchenaid stand mixer, no arm muscles! Added 1/4 tsp cinnamon, just to see what would happen, might add just a bit more next time. Waiting on family to try.

I have made these about 4 times now. Really good. 
I use Cup4Cup GF flour and my GF oats from Trader Joes are not quick cooking oats, but the cookies come out great- my husband’s favorite now.
Pretty good, will definitely make again
Absolutely fabulous. I used 1 cup raisins and 1 cup walnuts. Can’t wait to try with 1 cup craisins and 1 cup nuts. I don’t like too sweet so these are great combos for me.

This is a great recipe! This produces a nice cookie that is crisp outside and chewy inside. I substituted the raisins with 1 c. of chopped walnuts for my taste. Tried other recipes and this is the best oatmeal craisin cookie so far.

Really delicious recipe. I added 1 t. cinnamon, an extra 1/2 t. vanilla extract, and 1 c. milk chocolate chips. I used 2 c. of craisins instead of 1 c. raisins and 1 c. craisins. Next time, I would only use 1 c. craisins and 2 c. milk chocolate chips (we really love chocolate) to make half the cookies then add about 1/2 c. pecans for the last half of the cookies (for my Mom). However, this recipe is fantastic as is.
My partner loved these. I would use less cranberries and put in some milk chocolate.Great recipe, I will make them again soon
These cookies are delicious and easy to make. However, I have never made them with the raisins.
Excellent cookie! I used dark brown sugar as that’s all I had; replaced the 1C raisins with semi-sweet chocolate chips; added a bit of cinnamon and fresh ground nutmeg. Delish.
They’re really delicious. The only change I made was I added 1C walnuts & 3 tbsp butter.

Stayed true to recipe except that I used large flaked oats because that is what I had on hand, and added a dash of cinnamon. Don’t look any further than this recipe when looking for an oatmeal cookie recipe. These cookies are delicious.
This was a delicious recipe, my family loved it so much.

These cookies are fantastic! Kudos to the chef who created this recipe! I work in a rest home with lots of older folks some hard to please. My boss gave me cranberries and said figure out what to do with these they are good for them LOL! I have found my perfect solution!They love them!
only used raisins - really good recipe
These cookies came out supreme!! They are delicious. I didn’t have raisins, my kids aren’t fans. Instead I put a cup of craisins, a cup of chopped walnuts, a couple she
for easy to make and very tasty cookies

Recipe is great as is--I made these with my 3 year olds (used craisins and choc chips). They stayed chewy and yummy for at least 4 days! They seemed to be begging for nuts though so next time I will do craisins and walnuts!

Small changes: No raisins, so I just omitted. I used 1/4 white sugar as I had sweetened cranberries so I was worried they would be too sweet, used tablespoon of chia seeds and 3 tablespoons of flax seeds, then lessened the flour accordingly. Yum, yum!

Awesome recipe. Added 1 cup (total 3) of old fashioned oats, dash of cinnamon and 2 cups craisins (skipped the raisins). Added recipe to my favorites. Will consider chocolate chips and chopped walnuts next time.
DONT DO IT!!!! An error somewhere in recipe. Melts into a big goo mess!!
It’s a very good recipe. The texture achieved from using all APF is soft and smooth. Perfect with the cranberries. Baked them twice in this week.
I've made these many times, they are SOOO GOOD! I wouldn't dare change them though I confess I've also used it when I had only raisins, and they're still AMAZING.
I liked them a lot! They disappeared in 3 days. I actually changed the raisins to craisins because I love craisins. I found that I had to bake them a bit longer too.
Needed to add more flour and substituted white chocolate chips for the raisins. Very good.

Delicious cookie! I only had 1/2 cup of brown sugar on hand, so I used a total of 1.5 cups of granulated sugar. I also only used cranberries and my family could not stop eating them! Will be making again soon.
Delicious and easy!
All craisins plus white chocolate chips. It's heavy on the butter in the recipe, and evident in the taste of the end product. Really love this recipe!!!

Great Recipe. Made these Gluten free using cup for cup flower and Bobs Redmill GF oats.I took other reviewers suggestions and added an additional cup of oats, 1.5 tsp cinnamon, used 2 cups craisins and no raisins. I used an icecream scoop as we like large cookies, recipe yields 24 cookies. Bake for 15-17 mins. I freeze most of the uncooked cookies on a cookie tray and then put into freezer bag so we can have fresh cookies any time.

Delicious recipe! I made the following changes: based on other reviews I added 1 cup oats (used thick cut rolled oats rather than quick oats) and 1 teaspoon cinnamon. It was a little dry with the extra oats, so I also added appox 1/4 cup avocado oil. In addition, I substituted half the white flour for whole wheat and reduced the sugar to 3/4 cup each (in the future I would reduce it further). I also omitted the raisins and added 1/2 cup mini chocolate chips. The kids and their friends loved them! This recipe made almost 6 dozen cookies!

Yum! It's been over 10 years since I baked cookies from scratch. This recipe was easy to follow. I did modify the recipe by using rolled oat (not quick), 1 cup of white and 1 cup of wheat flour, no raisins but 2 cups of craisins. I think it would have been even more delicious with white chocolate chips if I had some in my kitchen. Great recipe!

I can’t say enough good things about this cookie recipe. I’ll bake 3 dozen & they’re gone in 2-3 days. I hate when people leave great reviews but then basically note how they changed just about everything in the recipe. I used craisins & white chocolate chips, because it what I had in my panty. This cookie recipe is so yummy, you could use just about anything you’d like. I also added a little more oatmeal and a little less flour the 2nd time I made them because I was running low on flour & they came out a littler chewier which we loved!
Really yummy!
I substituted 1/2 cup shortening and did 2 cups dried cranberries only because I ran out of butter and didn’t have any raisins! Cookies are delicious!!!
These were excellent. I didn't have raisins, so used two cups of craisins and I didn't have quick oats so used old fashioned oats. They turned out great!

This is one of my favorite recipes! Delicious and allows flexibility with add-ins! 
I grind the quick oats in a spice grinder to make the batter a little easier to mix.
The recipe is too sugary and lacks spices for my taste. However I liked that the cookies are crispy on the outside and soft in the middle.
I give this a 4 because there almost how my gmas tasted but I feel like somethings missing..as for what idk maybe nutmeg instead of cinnamon..
I put raisins and walnuts in half and choc chips and walnuts in the other half. Used 1/2 C butter and 1/2 C margarine instead of all butter. All turned out excellent.
them things were fiya
Yummmy

This is one of the best oatmeal cookies I’ve ever made! I tweaked the recipe a little bit though! I added 2 teaspoons of cinnamon. I also used old fashion oats instead of what the recipe called for. I’ve noticed that the old fashion oats don’t soak up as much of the moisture. I also only added cranberries Instead of raisins.And a cup of chocolate chips. They are so soft and honestly the perfect cookie!
A great oatmeal cookie recipe. I still
This was the perfect recipe. I omitted the craisins and just used raisins. I’ve also made them as just plain oatmeal. They are perfect.
I get many requests for this cookie! Well-liked by everyone. Used blueberry infused dried cranberries.
minus 1/2 cup of brown sugar and 1/2 cup white sugar.
I use this as a base for my oatmeal cookies. I substitute dried cherries for the raisins and add a cup of Belgian white chocolate chips (not vanilla chips). Everyone raves about them!

These are first class cookies! I had crainsins this time & they were even better. I did add 1/2 tsp cinnamon because I like the taste in cookies. With the crainsins they were a bit dry. But still great!!
Delicious- I use all Craisins and a little extra salt. My kids love them!

Very good, not too sweet and I used all craisins. I love sweet stuff but these were just right, I could eat a couple and it wasn't too much. Baked up very nicely, a little brown on the edges and they were perfect.

I reduced the sugar, proportionally by 1/2 cup. I added one tsp cinnamon, would have used pumpkin pie spice but didn't have any on hand. I added 1 cup pecans instead o the raisins, and added an extra 1/2 cup of oatmeal
Absolutely delicious! I used golden raisins instead of the regular raisins. Almost skipped the five mins of mixing, glad I followed recipe the mixing created a delicate chewy texture.
These cookies are so good!! Thank you for sharing!

Simple to make, results are excellent. I am not much of a baker. This was my first foray into cookie making.

The first time I made 5 dozen or so cookies, if memory serves. I froze half or more of them, and they were just as good defrosted.

Making this for the second time today. Both times doubling the recipe. The first time, I reduced the white sugar by almost half, this time even less, about 3/4 Cup white to 2 cups dark brown for the doubled recipe.
I made these and we loved them. Will definitely make them again.
Amazing! "Too bad" I'm the only one in my house that likes oatmeal raisin cookies. I guess I'll just have to eat all of thee myself.

Amazing Cookies. I followed some of the suggestions - using 3 cups oats (1/2 regular & 1/2 quick cooking), 1 tsp. cinnamon and substituting the raisins for white chocolate chips. Made 5 dozen fantastic cookies. I will be making these often.
Followed exact recipe only changed to old fashioned oats. Came out crispy outside and chewy inside. Excellent cookies.
Half the recipe works up great for a quick family treat!
i added ginger ,taste delice

Only switch up was 2 sticks of “Can’t Believe It’s Not Butter” and egg substitute. Also, made it as a pan cookie b/c I don’t have patience for cookie making ...AMAZING - just as reviewed by others - crispy-on top, soft &chewy middle. KEEPER!!!
Great flavor and texture. LOTS of craisins and raisins!!!
Delicious but I did change it a bit! I substituted 3/4 cup of honey for white sugar and added 1 tsp of cinnamon. Will definitely make these again!!
Made per recipe. Used blueberry craisins, pdg! Even better the next day, then gone in this home
Great results even though I am not a great baker! Substituted Splenda for both brown and white sugar. Used 1/2 butter and 1/2 margarine.
Delicious! Added 1 teaspoon of cinnamon.

Baked two trays at same time heavy aluminum with parchment, this required additional cooking time of 8-10 minutes in 2 minute increments. One smaller tray cooked alone took the recipe time and was a nice golden brown, also those cookies puffed higher. the slower cooking ones were a bit flatter.
